overview: From 2025-08-29 to 2025-08-30, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 13 new PRs (3 merged), 10 new issues, and 32 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Coordinate GTM tasks for Flashblocks public enablement
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body: Assist Sanjana Mehta with tasks and strategies such as docs and coordinating with RaaS providers to get done associated with public GTM strategy for Flashblocks public sepolia.

topIssues.body: Coordinate and review Blessing's drafts of public docs he is prepping of flashblocks

topIssues.title: Subject: Inquiry Regarding Funds Sent to Unknown Address on Optimism Mainnet
topIssues.author: satyasenk2004
topIssues.body:
Dear Optimism Support Team,

I hope this message finds you well.

I am reaching out regarding a concerning issue that I encountered with a transaction on the Optimism Mainnet. I deployed a smart contract and executed some transactions (including creating documents) on behalf of my users. However, when I checked the funds in my wallet, I noticed that a portion of the funds was transferred to an unknown address.

Details of the Transaction:

My Wallet Address: 0x03267dCf2B2c7bd1533E80797606D61c738B8710

Transaction Hash: 0x72f4b30ce29ca8a393c255629d1ad209b0c4e9631c48a78414fe85d4062ebeea

Destination Address: 0xa1430Db6c10Bb0a920F9a15DA1e511Da34854604

I believe the funds may have been unintentionally sent to this address, which appears to be associated with a contract or vault address on the network. After further investigation, I found that the funds are still in the address 0xa1430Db6c10Bb0a920F9a15DA1e511Da34854604, but I do not know the ownership or control over this address.

I kindly request your assistance in the following:

Clarifying the nature of the destination address: Is this address related to any known contracts or systems on Optimism (such as a proxy contract or vault)?

Investigating the movement of funds: Can you help me understand why my funds were transferred to this address and if there is any action I can take to recover them?

Verification of the funds: Is it possible to track the movement of these funds or identify who controls this address?

I would greatly appreciate your support in resolving this issue, as it is critical for the integrity of my project.

Thank you for your time and assistance. I look forward to your response.

Best regards,
[KOLLIPARA RAMMOHAN SATYASEN]
[7075514762]

topIssues.title: [DA Footprint Limit] Implement `SystemConfig` DA footprint gas scalar update
topIssues.author: sebastianst
topIssues.body:
- [ ] Adapt specs PR to include configurability
- [ ] Add DA footprint gas scalar update event to `SystemConfig` and gas scalar to `L1Block`
- [ ] Add upgrade txs for Jovian activation block
- [ ] Adapt `L1BlockInfo` update in derivation
  - [ ] Set default value at Jovian activation
- [ ] EL: Read gas scalar from state inside block builder and block processor, instead of constant
- [ ] Acceptance test of configurability

topPRs.title: Draft LivenessModule2 implementation
topPRs.author: JosepBove
topPRs.body:
This pull request introduces the initial implementation of the LivenessModule2 specification. The goal of this work is to align the codebase with the proposed design outlined in the specification, ensuring consistency between the spec and the implementation.

The LivenessModule2 module is intended to provide stronger guarantees around system liveness and improve the robustness of the protocolâ€™s fault-handling mechanisms. By implementing this module, we take a step toward enhancing the reliability and safety of the system while maintaining compatibility with the evolving Optimism specifications.

For reference, the current version of the specification is available in the following specs PR: [ethereum-optimism/specs#751](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/pull/751?utm_source=chatgpt.com)
. This implementation reflects the details of that proposal and will continue to be updated as the specification evolves.

topPRs.title: proofs: Introduce PermissionedDisputeGame v2
topPRs.author: mbaxter
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Introduce `PermissionedDisputeGameV2` as part of migrating chain-specific configuration out of the game implementation constructors. For more context, see the [associated design doc](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/blob/main/protocol/proofs/dispute-game-creators.md) which explains the new game creation approach. 

The new `PermissionedDisputeGameV2` is not used anywhere in the codebase.  We will incrementally migrate to the new contracts in follow-up PRs.

**Tests**

Duplicate and update existing `PermissionedDisputeGame` tests.

**Additional context**

Builds on https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17119

**Metadata**

Fixes https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/17255

topPRs.title: feat: add feature flagging functionality to SystemConfig
topPRs.author: smartcontracts
topPRs.body: Adds a function to the SystemConfig for feature flagging. Features are identified by 32 byte strings and can be toggled on or off by the ProxyAdmin or the owner of the ProxyAdmin. Note that this commit does not actually use any feature flags but demonstrates what a feature flag would look like by adding in the flag for the ETHLockbox feature.

topPRs.title: op-devstack: Explicit Sync Tester EL and API Session Binding
topPRs.author: pcw109550
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Explicitly expose read only EL to be accessed at preset. We can interact with the EL using the DSL.

Added `APIWithSession()` method to explicitly bind the session id while in tests.  Note that there will be APIs that does not require a session, such as `sync_listSessions`, in this case we can use the original `API()` method.

Preparation of https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/16778.

**Tests**

All existing tests are passing

**Additional context**

Want to share my findings which can be addressed in future cleanup PRs:

There is some non-intuitive design of the devstack abstraction around sync tester.

```go
// Caveat: id is binded by a single EL(chainID), but service can support multiple ELs
type SyncTesterService struct {
	id      stack.SyncTesterID
	service *synctester.Service
}
```

```go
type SyncTesterID idWithChain
```
but the `service` can manage multiple ELs(multiple chain IDs) so there is an inconsistency.

completedItems.title: op-devstack: Fix flakiness in AwaitTimestamp
completedItems.body:
**Description**

There's no guarantee that a waiter will see every block, so just find the block the fork should activate and wait for it specifically.

completedItems.title: op-deployer: enable embedded artifacts integration test
completedItems.body: Previously we only ran the op-deployer integration test for `default tagged artifacts` on backports+proposal branches. Now that the artifacts are embedded (i.e. contracts live on the same branch as op-deployer), we should always run that te

completedItems.title: LivenessModule - Slightly simplified code
completedItems.body: Substituted a `for` for a `while` and made `sentinel` a constant.
